channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Their house was purchased with my family money’: My late father left a life estate to his second wife. She’s only 10 years older than me. How can I undo this?
item.description: “Apparently the probate laws in Florida are different, perhaps superseding the will.”

item.title: Visa Wanted a Vast Empire. First, It Had to Beat Back Its Foes.
item.description: By wooing partners and strong-arming competitors, Visa sits atop the payments world and in the sights of the Justice Department.

item.title: ‘I feel like I’m missing something’: I’m 68, divorced with two children. I’ve $750,000 and rent my home. Do I need a trust?
item.description: “I continue to reinvest the dividends and interest so my investments continue to grow.”

item.title: This 401(k) lawsuit showcases the power of a 50-year-old law
item.description: Erisa laid the foundation for retirement security, but more laws will bolster it in the years to come.

item.title: Your parents’ Medicare decisions could come back to haunt you
item.description: Adult children may regret not paying attention to these healthcare choices.

item.title: The Score: Netflix, Morgan Stanley, TSMC and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: It's Time to Bring 401(k)s Into the 21st Century
item.description: The retirement savings plans don’t fit the increasingly mobile workforce of today. There’s an easy way to fix that.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Falls 0.3% To 98.10
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index fell 0.3% to 98.10 — snapping a five-trading-day winning streak.

item.title: We’re 57, and our work is unpleasant and tiresome. We have $800,000 in 401(k) plans and $1.15 million in a pension. Can we just retire already?
item.description: Have a question about your own retirement savings? Email us at HelpMeRetire@marketwatch.com

item.title: Why Do Health Insurers Keep Getting Slammed With Higher Costs?
item.description: Investors are fleeing the sector as health insurers are repeatedly surprised by rising healthcare costs.
